00066 /*****************************************************************************\
00067  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00068  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00069  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00070  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00071  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00072  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00073  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00074 \*****************************************************************************/

00084 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00085 #define M_SH_SIZE_VOID          0
00086 #define M_SH_SIZE_BIT           1
00087 #define M_SH_SIZE_CHAR          8
00088 #define M_SH_SIZE_SHORT         16
00089 #define M_SH_SIZE_INT           32
00090 #define M_SH_SIZE_LONG          32
00091 #define M_SH_SIZE_FLOAT         32
00092 #define M_SH_SIZE_DOUBLE        64
00093 #define M_SH_SIZE_POINTER       32
00094 #define M_SH_SIZE_UNION         -1
00095 #define M_SH_SIZE_STRUCT        -1
00096 #define M_SH_SIZE_BLOCK         -1
00097 #define M_SH_SIZE_MAX           64
00098 
00099 #define M_SH_ALIGN_VOID         -1
00100 #define M_SH_ALIGN_BIT          1
00101 #define M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR         8
00102 #define M_SH_ALIGN_SHORT        16
00103 #define M_SH_ALIGN_INT          32
00104 #define M_SH_ALIGN_LONG         32
00105 #define M_SH_ALIGN_FLOAT        32
00106 #define M_SH_ALIGN_DOUBLE       64
00107 #define M_SH_ALIGN_POINTER      32
00108 #define M_SH_ALIGN_UNION        -1      /* depends on the field */
00109 #define M_SH_ALIGN_STRUCT       -1
00110 #define M_SH_ALIGN_BLOCK        -1
00111 #define M_SH_ALIGN_MAX          64
00112 #define M_SH_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX   128
00113 
00114 
00115 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00116     /* can pass at most 4 parameters in registers */
00117 #define M_SH_MAX_FNVAR_REG      4
00118     /* offset from SP to start of incoming and outgoing paramter space
00119        prior to phase 2 annotation */
00120 #define M_SH_PARAM_FP_OFFSET    0
00121     /* first parameter passing register is r4 for both integer and float,
00122        incoming and outgoing */
00123 #define M_SH_IN_BASE    4
00124 #define M_SH_FLT_BASE   4
00125 #define M_SH_OUT_BASE   4
00126     /* return value is in r0 */
00127 #define M_SH_RET_IN     0
00128 #define M_SH_RET_OUT    0
00129 #define M_SH_RET_F      0
00130 
00131 #define M_SH_ST 0
00132 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/

00134 void
00135 M_sh_void (M_Type type)
00136 {
00137   type->type = M_TYPE_VOID;
00138   type->unsign = 1;
00139   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_VOID;
00140   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_VOID;
00141   type->nbits = 0;
00142 }
00143 
00144 void
00145 M_sh_bit_long (M_Type type, int n)
00146 {
00147   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00148   type->unsign = 0;
00149   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_BIT;
00150   type->size = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00151   type->nbits = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00152   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00153             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00154 }
00155 
00156 void
00157 M_sh_bit_int (M_Type type, int n)
00158 {
00159   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_INT;
00160   type->unsign = 0;
00161   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_BIT;
00162   type->size = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00163   type->nbits = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00164   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00165             "M_bit_int: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00166 }
00167 
00168 void
00169 M_sh_bit_short (M_Type type, int n)
00170 {
00171   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00172   type->unsign = 0;
00173   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_BIT;
00174   type->size = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00175   type->nbits = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00176   M_assert ((n <= 16),
00177             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00178 }
00179 
00180 void
00181 M_sh_bit_char (M_Type type, int n)
00182 {
00183   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR;
00184   type->unsign = 0;
00185   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_BIT;
00186   type->size = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00187   type->nbits = n * M_SH_SIZE_BIT;
00188   M_assert ((n <= 8),
00189             "M_bit_char: do not allow bit field of more than 8 bits");
00190 }
00191 
00192 void
00193 M_sh_float (M_Type type, int unsign)
00194 {
00195   type->type = M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00196   type->unsign = unsign;
00197   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00198   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_FLOAT;
00199   type->nbits = M_SH_SIZE_FLOAT;
00200 }
00201 
00202 void
00203 M_sh_double (M_Type type, int unsign)
00204 {
00205   type->type = M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00206   type->unsign = unsign;
00207   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00208   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00209   type->nbits = M_SH_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00210 }
00211 
00212 void
00213 M_sh_pointer (M_Type type)
00214 {
00215   type->type = M_TYPE_POINTER;
00216   type->unsign = 1;
00217   type->align = M_SH_ALIGN_POINTER;
00218   type->size = M_SH_SIZE_POINTER;
00219   type->nbits = M_SH_SIZE_POINTER;
00220 }

00224 int
00225 M_sh_eval_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00226 {
00227   switch (type->type)
00228     {
00229     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00230       M_void (ntype);
00231       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00232     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00233     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00234     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00235     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00236     case M_TYPE_INT:
00237     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00238     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00239     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00240       /* the starting address of array is used */
00241       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00242       return M_TYPE_INT;
00243     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00244       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00245       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00246     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00247       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00248       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00249     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00250     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00251       *ntype = *type;
00252       return type->type;
00253     default:
00254       return -1;
00255     }
00256 }
00257 
00258 int
00259 M_sh_eval_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00260 {
00261   switch (type->type)
00262     {
00263     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00264       M_void (ntype);
00265       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00266     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00267     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00268       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00269       return (M_TYPE_CHAR);
00270     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00271       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00272       return (M_TYPE_SHORT);
00273     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00274     case M_TYPE_INT:
00275       /* the starting address of array is used */
00276       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00277       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00278     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00279     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00280       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00281       return (M_TYPE_LONG);
00282     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00283       M_pointer (ntype);
00284       return (M_TYPE_POINTER);
00285     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00286       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00287       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00288     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00289       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00290       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00291     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00292     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00293       *ntype = *type;
00294       return type->type;
00295     default:
00296       return -1;
00297     }
00298 }

00301 int
00302 M_sh_call_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00303 {
00304   switch (type->type)
00305     {
00306     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00307       M_void (ntype);
00308       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00309     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00310     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00311       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00312       return M_TYPE_CHAR;
00313     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00314       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00315       return M_TYPE_SHORT;
00316     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00317     case M_TYPE_INT:
00318     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00319     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00320     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00321       /* the starting address of array is used */
00322       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00323       return M_TYPE_INT;
00324     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00325       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00326       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00327     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00328       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00329       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00330     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00331     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00332       *ntype = *type;
00333       return type->type;
00334     default:
00335       return -1;
00336     }
00337 }
00338 int
00339 M_sh_call_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00340 {
00341   switch (type->type)
00342     {
00343     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00344       M_void (ntype);
00345       return -1;                /* can not be evaluated */
00346     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00347     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00348       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00349       return M_TYPE_CHAR;
00350     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00351       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00352       return M_TYPE_SHORT;
00353     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00354     case M_TYPE_INT:
00355       /* the starting address of array is used */
00356       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00357       return M_TYPE_INT;
00358     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00359     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00360       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00361       return M_TYPE_LONG;
00362     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00363       M_pointer (ntype);
00364       return M_TYPE_POINTER;
00365     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00366       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00367       return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00368     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00369       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00370       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00371     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00372     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00373       *ntype = *type;
00374       return type->type;
00375     default:
00376       return -1;
00377     }
00378 }

00380 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00381 void
00382 M_sh_array_layout (M_Type type, int *offset)
00383 {
00384   *offset = 0;                  /* assume first element is aligned */
00385 }
00386 
00387 int
00388 M_sh_array_align (M_Type type)
00389 {
00390   return type->align;
00391 }
00392 
00393 int
00394 M_sh_array_size (M_Type type, int dim)
00395 {
00396   int mod, size, align;
00397   size = type->size;
00398   align = type->align;
00399   mod = size % align;
00400   if (mod != 0)
00401     size += (align - mod);
00402   return (size * dim);
00403 }
00404 
00405 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00406 void
00407 M_sh_union_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *offset, int *bit_offset)
00408 {
00409   int i;
00410   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00411     {                           /* assume the union is aligned */
00412       offset[i] = 0;
00413       bit_offset[i] = 0;
00414     }
00415 }
00416 
00417 int
00418 M_sh_union_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00419 {
00420   int i, max;
00421   max = 0;
00422   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00423     {
00424       int aln = type[i].align;
00425       if (aln > max)
00426         max = aln;
00427     }
00428   /*
00429    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00430    */
00431   if (max < M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR)
00432     max = M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00433   return max;
00434 }
00435 
00436 int
00437 M_sh_union_size (int n, _M_Type * type)
00438 {
00439   int i, aln, max_size, max_align;
00440   max_size = 0;
00441   max_align = 0;
00442   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00443     {
00444       int size;
00445       size = type[i].size;
00446       if (size > max_size)
00447         max_size = size;
00448       aln = type[i].align;
00449       if (aln > max_align)
00450         max_align = aln;
00451     }
00452   /*
00453    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00454    */
00455   if (max_align < M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR)
00456     max_align = M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00457   /* need to increment to the max. align for future array extension */
00458   i = max_size % max_align;
00459   if (i != 0)
00460     max_size += (max_align - i);
00461   return max_size;
00462 }
00463 
00464 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00465 void
00466 M_sh_struct_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *base, int *bit_offset)
00467 {
00468   int i, offset;
00469   int mod, size, align;
00470   offset = 0;                   /* assume initially aligned */
00471   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00472     {
00473       size = type[i].size;
00474       align = type[i].align;
00475       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00476                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00477       /*
00478        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00479        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00480        */
00481       if ((i != 0) &&
00482           (type[i].type != M_TYPE_BIT_LONG) &&
00483           (type[i].type != M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR))
00484         {
00485           if (type[i - 1].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00486             {
00487               mod = offset % M_SH_ALIGN_INT;
00488               if (mod != 0)
00489                 offset += (M_SH_ALIGN_INT - mod);
00490             }
00491           else if (type[i - 1].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00492             {
00493               mod = offset % M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00494               if (mod != 0)
00495                 offset += (M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR - mod);
00496             }
00497         }
00498       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00499         {
00500           int mod1;
00501           mod1 = offset % M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00502           /* +++++ This may not be correct; may need to always goto next int */
00503           if ((mod1 + size) > M_SH_SIZE_INT)
00504             {
00505               /* need to go to the next word */
00506               offset += (M_SH_SIZE_INT - mod1);
00507             }
00508         }
00509       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00510         {
00511           int mod1;
00512           mod1 = offset % M_SH_SIZE_CHAR;
00513           if ((mod1 + size) > M_SH_SIZE_CHAR)
00514             {
00515               /* need to go to the next char */
00516               offset += (M_SH_SIZE_CHAR - mod1);
00517             }
00518         }
00519       mod = offset % align;     /* align to what the field */
00520       if (mod != 0)             /* needs to start from */
00521         offset += (align - mod);
00522       base[i] = offset;
00523       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00524         {
00525           bit_offset[i] = (M_SH_SIZE_LONG - type[i].nbits) -
00526             (offset % M_SH_SIZE_LONG);
00527         }
00528       else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
00529         {
00530           bit_offset[i] = (M_SH_SIZE_SHORT - type[i].nbits) -
00531             (offset % M_SH_SIZE_SHORT);
00532         }
00533       else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00534         {
00535           bit_offset[i] = (M_SH_SIZE_CHAR - type[i].nbits) -
00536             (offset % M_SH_SIZE_CHAR);
00537         }
00538       else
00539         {
00540           bit_offset[i] = 0;
00541         }
00542       offset += size;           /* allocate space */
00543     }
00544 }
00545 
00546 int
00547 M_sh_struct_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00548 {
00549   int i, max;
00550   max = 0;
00551   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00552     {
00553       int aln = type[i].align;
00554       if (aln > max)
00555         max = aln;
00556     }
00557   /*
00558    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00559    */
00560   if (max < M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR)
00561     max = M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00562   return max;
00563 }
00564 
00565 int
00566 M_sh_struct_size (int n, _M_Type * type, int struct_align)
00567 {
00568   int i, offset;
00569   int mod, size, align, max_align;
00570   offset = 0;                   /* assume initially aligned */
00571   max_align = 0;
00572   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00573     {
00574       size = type[i].size;
00575       align = type[i].align;
00576       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00577                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00578       if (align > max_align)
00579         max_align = align;
00580       /*
00581        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00582        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00583        */
00584       if ((i != 0) && (type[i].type != M_TYPE_BIT_LONG) &&
00585           (type[i].type != M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR))
00586         {
00587           if (type[i - 1].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00588             {
00589               mod = offset % M_SH_ALIGN_INT;
00590               if (mod != 0)
00591                 offset += (M_SH_ALIGN_INT - mod);
00592             }
00593           else if (type[i - 1].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00594             {
00595               mod = offset % M_SH_ALIGN_INT;
00596               if (mod != 0)
00597                 offset += (M_SH_ALIGN_INT - mod);
00598             }
00599         }
00600       if ((type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00601           || (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR))
00602         {
00603           int mod1;
00604           mod1 = offset % M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00605           if ((mod1 + size) > M_SH_SIZE_INT)
00606             {
00607               /* need to go to the next word */
00608               offset += (M_SH_SIZE_INT - mod1);
00609             }
00610         }
00611       mod = offset % align;
00612       if (mod != 0)
00613         offset += (align - mod);
00614       offset += size;
00615     }
00616   /*
00617    *    align to at least byte boundary.
00618    */
00619   if (max_align < M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR)
00620     max_align = M_SH_ALIGN_CHAR;
00621   /* enforce max. alignment */
00622   mod = offset % max_align;
00623   if (mod != 0)
00624     offset += (max_align - mod);
00625   return offset;
00626 }
00627 
00628 int
00629 M_sh_layout_fnvar (List param_list, char **base_macro, int *pcount,
00630                    int purpose)
00631 {
00632   M_Param param;
00633   M_Type type;
00634   long int *offset;
00635   int *mode;
00636   int *reg;
00637   int *paddr;
00638   int *su_sreg;
00639   int *su_ereg;
00640   int cnt, i, size;
00641 
00642   cnt = List_size (param_list);
00643 
00644   type = alloca (cnt * sizeof (_M_Type));
00645   offset = alloca (cnt * sizeof (long int));
00646   mode = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00647   reg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00648   paddr= alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00649   su_sreg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00650   su_ereg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00651 
00652   List_start (param_list);
00653   i = 0;
00654   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00655     {
00656       type[i++] = param->mtype;
00657     }
00658 
00659   size = M_sh_fnvar_layout (cnt, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
00660                             base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg, pcount,
00661                             0, purpose);
00662 
00663   List_start (param_list);
00664   i = 0;
00665   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00666     {
00667       param->offset = offset[i];
00668       param->mode = mode[i];
00669       param->reg = reg[i];
00670       param->paddr = paddr[i];
00671       param->su_sreg = su_sreg[i];
00672       param->su_ereg = su_ereg[i];
00673       i++;
00674     }
00675 
00676     return size;
00677 }
00678 
00679 
00680 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00681 /* Layout incoming and outgoing parameters.  Return total size of parameter
00682    passing area. */
00683 /* DML - changed to provide separate offset calculations for incoming and
00684    outgoing parameters */
00685 int
00686 M_sh_fnvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, int *mode,
00687                    int *reg, int *paddr, char **macro,
00688                    int *su_sreg, int *su_ereg,
00689                    int *pcount, int is_st, int purpose)
00690 {
00691   int i, max_align, off, rg, rg_base = 0;
00692   int size, tp;
00693   int param_size;               /* total size of parameter passing area */
00694 
00695   switch (purpose)
00696     {
00697     case M_PUT_FNVAR:
00698       rg_base = M_SH_OUT_BASE;
00699       *macro = "$OP";
00700       off = 0;
00701       break;
00702     case M_GET_FNVAR:
00703       rg_base = M_SH_IN_BASE;
00704       *macro = "$IP";
00705       off = 0;
00706       break;
00707     case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00708     default:
00709       M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: unknown purpose");
00710       return (-1);
00711     }
00712 
00713   rg = 0;
00714   max_align = M_SH_ALIGN_MAX;
00715 
00716   /* All but first 4 parameters are passed on stack.  All parameters passed
00717      as longwords. */
00718   param_size = (n - M_SH_MAX_FNVAR_REG) * M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00719 
00720   /* determine how to pass parameter */
00721   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00722     {
00723       tp = type[i].type;
00724       switch (tp)
00725         {
00726         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00727         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00728         case M_TYPE_INT:
00729         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00730         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00731           if (rg < M_SH_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00732             {
00733               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00734               reg[i] = rg + rg_base;
00735               rg++;
00736             }
00737           else
00738             {
00739               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00740               reg[i] = -1;
00741             }
00742           break;
00743 
00744         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00745         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00746           if (rg < M_SH_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00747             {
00748               mode[i] = M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER;
00749               reg[i] = rg + rg_base;
00750               rg++;
00751             }
00752           else
00753             {
00754               mode[i] = M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY;
00755               reg[i] = -1;
00756             }
00757           break;
00758 
00759         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00760           mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00761           reg[i] = -1;
00762           break;
00763         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00764           if (rg < M_SH_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00765             {
00766               mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00767               reg[i] = rg + rg_base;
00768               rg++;
00769             }
00770           else
00771             {
00772               mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00773               reg[i] = -1;
00774             }
00775           break;
00776 
00777         default:
00778           M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: argument is not promoted");
00779         }
00780 
00781       /* no offset calculation needed for register parameters */
00782       if (mode[i] == M_THRU_REGISTER)
00783         {
00784           offset[i] = 0;
00785           continue;
00786         }
00787 
00788       /* Figure out sizes and offsets for parameters passed on stack */
00789 
00790       if ((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) || (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT))
00791         {
00792           /* for the pointer to the structure */
00793           size = M_SH_SIZE_POINTER;
00794         }
00795       else
00796         {
00797           size = type[i].size;
00798         }
00799 
00800       switch (purpose)
00801         {
00802         case M_PUT_FNVAR:
00803           /* All parameters placed on stack as full 32-bit parameters, i.e.
00804              some stack space wasted when passing bytes and words.  Since
00805              all parameters are the same size, no alignment is needed.  Stack
00806              grows toward lower addresses. */
00807           offset[i] = off;
00808           off += M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00809           break;
00810         case M_GET_FNVAR:
00811           /* Because all parameters are placed on stack as full 32-bit 
00812              longwords, no need for alignment here either.  However, need
00813              to access correct bytes within longword in big endian format. */
00814           offset[i] = off + M_SH_SIZE_INT - size;
00815           off += M_SH_SIZE_INT;
00816           break;
00817         case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00818         default:
00819           M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: unknown purpose");
00820         }
00821     }
00822 
00823   *pcount = rg;
00824   return param_size;            /* the total size needed */
00825 }
00826 
00827 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00828 int
00829 M_sh_lvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, char **base_macro)
00830 {
00831   int i, max_align, off;
00832   int size, align, mod, tp;
00833   /*
00834    *    the LOCAL section must be max. aligned initially
00835    */
00836   max_align = M_SH_ALIGN_MAX;
00837   off = 0;
00838   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00839     {
00840       tp = type[i].type;
00841       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00842         {
00843           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
00844         }
00845       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00846         {
00847           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
00848         }
00849       size = type[i].size;
00850       align = type[i].align;
00851       mod = off % align;
00852       if (mod != 0)
00853         off -= (align + mod);
00854       off -= size;
00855       offset[i] = off;
00856     }
00857   /* the local section must be max. aligned */
00858   mod = off % max_align;
00859   if (mod != 0)
00860     off -= (max_align + mod);
00861   /*
00862    *    Local variables are relative to $LV
00863    */
00864   *base_macro = "$LV";
00865   return -off;                  /* the total size needed */
00866 }
00867 
00868 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00869 int
00870 M_sh_no_short_int (void)
00871 {
00872   return (M_SH_SIZE_SHORT == M_SH_SIZE_INT);
00873 }
00874 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00875 void
00876 M_sh_cb_label_name (char *fn, int cb, char *line, int len)
00877 {
00878   sprintf (line, "Lcb%d%s", cb, fn);
00879 }
00880 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00881 int
00882 M_sh_is_cb_label (char *label, char *fn, int *cb)
00883 {
00884   return (sscanf (label, "Lcb%d%s", cb, fn) == 2);
00885 }
00886 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00887 void
00888 M_sh_jumptbl_label_name (char *fn, int tbl_id, char *line, int len)
00889 {
00890   sprintf (line, "%s%s%d", fn, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, tbl_id);
00891 }
00892 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00893 /* Format for sh is: %sM_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME%d, where %s is the func name */
00894 int
00895 M_sh_is_jumptbl_label (char *label, char *fn, int *tbl_id)
00896 {
00897   char *ptr;
00898   int label_len, fn_len, base_len;
00899 
00900   /* Some length checks, to make sure we dont step outside array */
00901   label_len = strlen (label);
00902   fn_len = strlen (fn);
00903   base_len = strlen (M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME);
00904   if (label_len <= (2 + fn_len + base_len))
00905     return (0);
00906 
00907   /* Check that fn is correct */
00908   ptr = label;
00909   if (strncmp (ptr, fn, fn_len))
00910     return (0);
00911 
00912   /* Check that jumptbl base name is correct */
00913   ptr += fn_len;
00914   if (strncmp (ptr, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, base_len))
00915     return (0);
00916 
00917   /* Get the id */
00918   ptr += base_len;
00919   return (sscanf (ptr, "%d", tbl_id) == 1);
00920 }
00921 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00922 int
00923 M_sh_structure_pointer (int purpose)
00924 {
00925   return M_SH_ST;
00926 }
00927 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00928 int
00929 M_sh_return_register (int type, int purpose)
00930 {
00931   switch (type)
00932     {
00933     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00934     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00935       return M_SH_RET_F;
00936     default:
00937       switch (purpose)
00938         {
00939         case M_GET_FNVAR:
00940           return M_SH_RET_OUT;
00941         case M_PUT_FNVAR:
00942           return M_SH_RET_IN;
00943         case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00944         default:
00945           return -1;
00946         }
00947       /*return M_SH_RET_IN; */
00948     }
00949 }
00950 
00951 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00952 char *
00953 M_sh_fn_label_name (char *label, int (*is_func) (char *is_func_label))
00954 {
00955   /* REH 5/18/95 made to simply return the label */
00956   return (label);
00957 #if 0
00958   static char fn_label[64];
00959 
00960   sprintf (fn_label, "_%s", label);
00961   return (fn_label);
00962 #endif
00963 }
00964 
00965 char *
00966 M_sh_fn_name_from_label (char *label)
00967 {
00968   /* REH 5/18/95 made to simply return the label */
00969   return (label);
00970 #if 0
00971   return (label + 1);
00972 #endif
00973 }
00974 
00975 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00976 /*
00977  *  Declare code generator specific macro registers to the front end parser.
00978  */
00979 void
00980 M_define_macros_sh (STRING_Symbol_Table * sym_tbl)
00981 {
00982   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "leaf", L_SH_MAC_LEAF);
00983   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "alloc", L_SH_MAC_ALLOC);
00984   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "callee_regs", L_SH_MAC_CALLEE);
00985   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "caller_regs", L_SH_MAC_CALLER);
00986   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$SR", L_SH_MAC_SR);
00987   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$PR", L_SH_MAC_PR);
00988 }
00989 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00990 int
00991 M_sh_fragile_macro (int macro_value)
00992 {
00993   switch (M_model)
00994     {
00995     case M_SH_1:
00996     case M_SH_2:
00997       switch (macro_value)
00998         {
00999         case L_MAC_SP:
01000         case L_MAC_FP:
01001         case L_MAC_LV:
01002         case L_MAC_IP:
01003         case L_MAC_OP:
01004         case L_MAC_LOCAL_SIZE:
01005         case L_MAC_PARAM_SIZE:
01006         case L_MAC_SWAP_SIZE:
01007           return 0;
01008         default:
01009           return (1);
01010         }
01011     default:
01012       M_assert (0, "M_sh_fragile_macro:  Illegal model specified!");
01013       return (0);
01014     }
01015 }
01016 
01017 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01018 Set M_sh_fragile_macro_set ()
01019 {
01020   switch (M_model)
01021     {
01022     case M_SH_1:
01023     case M_SH_2:
01024       return NULL;
01025     default:
01026       M_assert (0, "M_sh_fragile_macro_set:  Illegal model specified!");
01027       return (0);
01028     }
01029 
01030 }
01031 
01032 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01033 int
01034 M_sh_dataflow_macro (int id)
01035 {
01036   switch (M_model)
01037     {
01038     case M_SH_1:
01039     case M_SH_2:
01040       return ((id >= L_MAC_P0 && id <= L_MAC_P64) || (id >= L_MAC_LAST));
01041     default:
01042       M_assert (0, "M_sh_dataflow_macro:  Illegal model specified!");
01043       return (0);
01044     }
01045 }
01046 
01047 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01048 int
01049 M_sh_subroutine_call (int opc)
01050 {
01051   switch (M_model)
01052     {
01053     case M_SH_1:
01054     case M_SH_2:
01055       return ((opc == Lop_JSR) || (opc == Lop_JSR_FS) ||
01056               (opc == Lop_REM) || (opc == Lop_REM_U));
01057     default:
01058       M_assert (0, "M_sh_subroutine_call:  Illegal model specified!");
01059       return (0);
01060     }
01061 }
01062 
01063 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01064 char *
01065 M_get_macro_name_sh (int id)
01066 {
01067   switch (id)
01068     {
01069     case L_SH_MAC_LEAF:
01070       return "leaf";
01071     case L_SH_MAC_ALLOC:
01072       return "alloc";
01073     case L_SH_MAC_CALLEE:
01074       return "callee_regs";
01075     case L_SH_MAC_CALLER:
01076       return "caller_regs";
01077     case L_SH_MAC_SR:
01078       return "$SR";
01079     case L_SH_MAC_PR:
01080       return "$PR";
01081     default:
01082       return ("?");
01083     }
01084 }
01085 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01086 /*
01087  * Return true (1) if the instruction is supported in the hardware of the
01088  * processor.  Return false (0) otherwise.
01089  *
01090  * Basically, those are the instructions that are splitted into multiple
01091  * instructions in phase1 of the SH code generator and the optimizer
01092  * will avoid generating them.
01093  */
01094 int
01095 M_oper_supported_in_arch_sh (int opc)
01096 {
01097   switch (opc)
01098     {
01099 
01100     case Lop_NOR:
01101     case Lop_NAND:
01102     case Lop_AND_NOT:
01103     case Lop_OR_NOT:
01104 
01105     case Lop_MUL_ADD:
01106     case Lop_MUL_SUB:
01107     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F:
01108     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F:
01109     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F2:
01110     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F2:
01111     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV:
01112     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_U:
01113     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F:
01114     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F2:
01115       return (0);
01116 
01117     default:
01118       return (1);
01119     }
01120 }
01121 
01122 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01123 int
01124 M_is_stack_operand_sh (L_Operand * operand)
01125 {
01126   if (L_is_macro (operand) &&
01127       (operand->value.mac == L_MAC_FP ||
01128        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_LV ||
01129        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_IP ||
01130        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_OP || operand->value.mac == L_MAC_RS))
01131     return (1);
01132 
01133   return (0);
01134 }
01135 
01136 int
01137 M_is_unsafe_macro_sh (L_Operand * operand)
01138 {
01139   return (0);
01140 }
01141 
01142 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01143 /*
01144  * Returns the number of machine instructions required to implement the
01145  * specified oper in the best case.  It is assumed that this is for
01146  * supported instructions.  A call to M_oper_supported_in_arch should be
01147  * made for abnormal instructions.
01148  *
01149  * SH v8 does not support any pre/post increment loads or stores
01150  * instructions.
01151  */
01152 int
01153 M_num_oper_required_for_sh (L_Oper * oper, char *name)
01154 {
01155   switch (oper->opc)
01156     {
01157     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC:
01158     case Lop_LD_PRE_C:
01159     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC2:
01160     case Lop_LD_PRE_C2:
01161     case Lop_LD_PRE_I:
01162 
01163     case Lop_ST_PRE_C:
01164     case Lop_ST_PRE_C2:
01165     case Lop_ST_PRE_I:
01166 
01167     case Lop_LD_POST_UC:
01168     case Lop_LD_POST_C:
01169     case Lop_LD_POST_UC2:
01170     case Lop_LD_POST_C2:
01171     case Lop_LD_POST_I:
01172 
01173     case Lop_ST_POST_C:
01174     case Lop_ST_POST_C2:
01175     case Lop_ST_POST_I:
01176 
01177     case Lop_LD_PRE_F:
01178     case Lop_LD_PRE_F2:
01179 
01180     case Lop_ST_PRE_F:
01181     case Lop_ST_PRE_F2:
01182 
01183     case Lop_LD_POST_F:
01184     case Lop_LD_POST_F2:
01185 
01186     case Lop_ST_POST_F:
01187     case Lop_ST_POST_F2:
01188       return (2);
01189 
01190     default:
01191       return (1);
01192     }
01193 }
01194 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01195 
01196 int
01197 M_operand_type_sh (L_Operand * operand)
01198 {
01199   if (operand == NULL)
01200     return (MDES_OPERAND_NULL);
01201   switch (L_operand_case_type (operand))
01202     {
01203     case L_OPERAND_INT:
01204       return (MDES_OPERAND_Lit);
01205     case L_OPERAND_MACRO:
01206     case L_OPERAND_REGISTER:
01207       return (MDES_OPERAND_REG);
01208     case L_OPERAND_CB:
01209     case L_OPERAND_LABEL:
01210     case L_OPERAND_FLOAT:
01211     case L_OPERAND_DOUBLE:
01212     case L_OPERAND_STRING:
01213       return (MDES_OPERAND_Label);
01214     default:
01215       M_assert (0, "M_operand_type_sh: Unknown type");
01216     }
01217   return (0);
01218 }
01219 
01220 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01221 
01222 /* Change this before we attempt to perform scheduling */
01223 
01224 int
01225 M_conflicting_operands_sh (L_Operand * operand, L_Operand ** conflict_array,
01226                            int len, int prepass)
01227 {
01228   int right = 0, left = 0, mac_pair;
01229 
01230   if (prepass && (!L_is_macro (operand)))
01231     {
01232       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01233       return (1);
01234     }
01235   if (L_is_macro (operand))
01236     {
01237       switch (operand->value.mac)
01238         {
01239         case L_MAC_P0:
01240         case L_MAC_P1:
01241         case L_MAC_P2:
01242         case L_MAC_P3:
01243         case L_MAC_P4:
01244         case L_MAC_P5:
01245         case L_MAC_P6:
01246         case L_MAC_P7:
01247         case L_MAC_P8:
01248         case L_MAC_P9:
01249         case L_MAC_P10:
01250         case L_MAC_P11:
01251           if (operand->value.mac & 0x1)
01252             {                   /* if odd macro */
01253               if (L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01254                 {
01255                   I_punt ("Mac %d: This macro shouldn't be type double!",
01256                           operand->value.mac);
01257                   return (-1);  /* I_punt doesn't return */
01258                 }
01259               else
01260                 mac_pair = operand->value.mac - 1;
01261             }
01262           else                  /* if even macro */
01263             mac_pair = operand->value.mac;
01264 
01265           /* Conflicts with its int type */
01266           conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01267           conflict_array[0]->ctype = L_CTYPE_INT;
01268 
01269           /* Conflicts with its float type */
01270           conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01271           conflict_array[1]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01272 
01273           /* Conflicts with its double type */
01274           conflict_array[2] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01275           conflict_array[2]->ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
01276           conflict_array[2]->value.mac = mac_pair;
01277 
01278           /* Assuming only even macros have type double.
01279            * Ex: (mac P0 f2) also conflicts with (mac P1 f) and (mac P1 i)
01280            *     (mac P2 f2)  "     "        "   (mac P3 f) and (mac P3 i)
01281            */
01282           if (operand->ctype == L_CTYPE_DOUBLE)
01283             {
01284               conflict_array[3] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01285               conflict_array[3]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01286               conflict_array[3]->value.mac = operand->value.mac + 1;
01287 
01288               conflict_array[4] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01289               conflict_array[4]->ctype = L_CTYPE_INT;
01290               conflict_array[4]->value.mac = operand->value.mac + 1;
01291               return (5);
01292             }
01293           else
01294             return (3);
01295         default:
01296           conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01297           return (1);
01298         }
01299     }
01300   else if (L_is_reg (operand))
01301     {
01302       /* int register */
01303       if (L_is_ctype_integer (operand))
01304         {
01305           conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01306           return (1);
01307         }
01308       else if (L_is_ctype_flt (operand) || L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01309         {
01310           if (operand->value.r & 0x1)
01311             {
01312               /* right side of a floating point register */
01313               left = operand->value.r - 1;
01314               right = operand->value.r;
01315             }
01316           else
01317             {
01318               /* left side of a floating point register */
01319               left = operand->value.r;
01320               right = operand->value.r + 1;
01321             }
01322         }
01323       else
01324         {
01325           M_assert (0, "Limpact_conflicting_operands: illegal reg number");
01326         }
01327     }
01328   else
01329     M_assert (0, "Lsh_conflicting_operands: unsupported operand type");
01330 
01331   if (L_is_ctype_dbl (operand))
01332     {
01333       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01334       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01335       conflict_array[0]->ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
01336       conflict_array[0]->value.r = left;
01337 
01338       /* Set up conflicting float register */
01339       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01340       conflict_array[1]->value.r = left;
01341       conflict_array[1]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01342 
01343       conflict_array[2] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01344       conflict_array[2]->value.r = right;
01345       conflict_array[2]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01346 
01347       return (3);
01348     }
01349   else if (L_is_ctype_flt (operand))
01350     {
01351       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01352       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01353       conflict_array[0]->ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
01354       conflict_array[0]->value.r = left;
01355 
01356       /* Set up conflicting float register */
01357       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01358       conflict_array[1]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01359 
01360       return (2);
01361     }
01362   else
01363     {
01364       M_assert (0, "M_conflicting_operands_sh: unsupported operand type");
01365       return (0);
01366     }
01367 }
01368 
01369 int
01370 M_num_registers_sh (int ctype)
01371 {
01372   switch (M_model)
01373     {
01374     case M_SH_1:
01375     case M_SH_2:
01376       switch (ctype)
01377         {
01378         case L_CTYPE_INT:
01379           return (16);
01380         case L_CTYPE_FLOAT:
01381           return (0);
01382         case L_CTYPE_DOUBLE:
01383           return (0);
01384         default:
01385           return (0);
01386         }
01387     default:
01388       M_assert (0, "M_num_registers_sh: unsupported model");
01389       return (0);
01390     }
01391 }
